page.title: 14Church and Chapel.
page.content: Although each parish in the block has its own parish church. the most noticeable feature of religious life in the area is the importance of { Methodism, one form of which, the Primitive Movement, had its birth at nearby Mow Cop. Each hamlet has its Methodist Chapel, mostly still functioning for worship and as a social centre. The Sunday School movement still flourishes in the area, in both church and chapel, but young people tend to "grow out" of it more quickly now. The local schools, though not necessarily having any definite connection with any church, try to keep a link with them. The High School in Chesterton invites ministers from local churches into school on special occasions.
